criteria: Understanding of the risks associated with sun exposure
Ability to explain the importance of sun safety
descriptions: Demonstrates no understanding of the risks of sun exposure.
Demonstrates a very limited understanding of the risks of sun exposure.
Identifies some risks of sun exposure, but with limited detail or accuracy.
Identifies several risks of sun exposure, including sunburn and premature aging.
Clearly explains several risks of sun exposure, including skin cancer, premature aging, and eye damage.
Comprehensively explains the various risks of sun exposure with supporting details.
Shows no awareness of sun safety practices.
Shows minimal awareness of sun safety practices.
Identifies one or two sun safety practices, such as wearing sunscreen.
Lists several sun safety practices, including seeking shade, wearing protective clothing, and using sunscreen.
Explains how to properly implement various sun safety practices.
Demonstrates comprehensive knowledge of sun safety practices and explains how to adapt them to different situations.
Unable to articulate any reasons why sun safety is important.
Struggles to explain the importance of sun safety.
Provides a vague explanation of why sun safety is important.
Explains the importance of sun safety in preventing sunburn.
Explains the importance of sun safety in preventing both short-term and long-term health problems.
Articulates the importance of sun safety with clear, persuasive reasoning, highlighting the benefits for overall health and well-being.
